Article Title: 1998 Coimbatore serial blast: Most-wanted Al-Umma operative ‘Tailor Raja’ arrested after 26 years; key supplier of bombs, linked to multiple murders
Article Text:
A Raja, also known as Tailor Raja, a key figure in the 1998 Coimbatore serial bomb blasts, has been arrested after evading capture for over two decades. Apprehended in Karnataka, he is accused of renting a house for bomb-making and distributing explosives to Al-Umma cadres.





COIMBATORE: In a major breakthrough, Coimbatore City Police on Wednesday arrested A Raja alias Tailor Raja (48), a most-wanted accused in the 1998 Coimbatore serial bomb blast case.Raja, a key operative of the banned terror group Al-Umma, had been absconding for over 26 years.Raja was apprehended in Karnataka following a tip-off and brought to Coimbatore late on Wednesday.Originally a resident of Bilal Estate in Ukkadam, Raja had been on the run since the blasts, which killed 58 people and injured over 200 on February 14, 1998.According to police, Raja was a tailor by profession and also did embroidery work before becoming involved in extremist activities.He played a crucial role in the Coimbatore blasts by distributing bombs to Al-Umma cadres between February 12 and 14, 1998.Investigators said Raja had rented a house at Vallal Nagar in Coimbatore where the bombs were manufactured and stored.Raja is also an accused in three murder cases — one registered at Nagore police station in 1996, and two others at Race Course (Coimbatore) and Karimedu (Madurai) police stations between 1996 and 1997.Meanwhile, another key suspect in the 1998 case, Mujibur Rehman of Oppanakara Street, remains absconding.A former Al-Umma state spokesperson, Rehman reportedly mobilised cadres, arranged pushcarts to plant explosives, and was present near the BJP rally venue on the day of the blasts.Police investigations continue as efforts are intensified to track down the remaining absconders involved in the terror attack that shook Coimbatore more than two decades ago.
Article Summary: A Raja alias Tailor Raja, a key figure in the 1998 Coimbatore serial bomb blasts, has been arrested after evading capture for over two decades. Apprehended in Karnataka, he is accused of renting a house for bomb-making and distributing explosives to Al-Umma cadres. The blasts killed 58 people and injured over 200 on February 14, 1998.

Article Title: Hyderabad heritage: 125-year-old Kotwal House restored; new police station buildings inaugurated
Article Text: HYDERABAD: The city's iconic Kotwal House - a 125-year-old Nizam-era colonial structure in the Old City that once served as the residence of the city police commissioner - has been restored after years of neglect.The restoration of Kotwal House was taken up under Greenko Pvt Ltd's CSR initiative. Hyderabad police commissioner CV Anand announced that he would rotate his presence across the city's three commissioner offices - working from Kotwal House on Fridays, Basheerbagh on Wednesdays, and the main ICCC Commissionerate on the remaining days.Inaugurating the revamped building, Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi urged the state govt to take up restoration of another landmark Sardar Mahal which currently houses the GHMC's South Zone office.On the occasion, new buildings for the Kalapathar, Chatrinaka, and Shalibanda police stations were also inaugurated.
Article Summary: Kotwal House is a 125-year-old Nizam-era colonial structure in the Old City. The restoration of Kotwal House was taken up under Greenko Pvt Ltd's CSR initiative. Hyderabad police commissioner CV Anand announced that he would rotate his presence across the city's three commissioner offices.

Article Title: Telangana HC slams SI for interfering in civil disputes
Article Text: HYDERABAD: The Telangana High Court reprimanded the cops for involving themselves in civil disputes and harassing individuals under the guise of settling these disputes in police stations. On Wednesday, the High Court criticised the Sub-Inspector of Chintapalli police station, Nalgonda district, for allegedly involving himself in a civil dispute concerning a 32-acre land and harassing individuals to settle the matter, as well as conducting a survey of the disputed land.While issuing notices to the DGP Telangana, Principal Secretary Home, SP Nalgonda, and DSP Devarakonda, Justice T Vinod Kumar also ordered the SI to submit his explanation regarding the matter. The judge passed the orders while dealing with a petition filed by a television presenter and her associate, who alleged harassment from SI Rammorthy of Chintapalli police station.During the arguments, the judge remarked that the cops have turned police stations into 'addas' for civil and land settlements. The petitioner contended that they purchased the said land from a private person in 2017, but now the same person is forcing them to part with the land and harassing them using the cops. Despite permanent injunctions in the matter from a lower court in their favour and orders to provide police protection to them, the local cops have been ignoring the court orders and further harassing them, the petitioners claimed. The matter is posted for further hearing in four weeks.
Article Summary: The High Court criticised the Sub-Inspector of Chintapalli police station, Nalgonda district, for allegedly involving himself in a civil dispute concerning a 32-acre land. Justice T Vinod Kumar also ordered the SI to submit his explanation regarding the matter.

Article Title: Who is Sanjay Gaikwad? Shiv Sena MLA who once wore a tiger tooth
Article Text:
-

Who is Sanjay Gaikwad?

Gaikwad is a two-time MLA from Buldhana, previously elected on a Shiv Sena ticket

In 2019, he defeated Harshawardhan Sapkal, who is currently the state Congress chief

A farmer by profession, he joined Eknath Shinde’s faction of Shiv Sena in 2022

A history of controversial remarks





MUMBAI: Shiv Sena MLA from Buldhana, Sanjay Gaikwad, defended his recent assault on a staff member at the MLAs’ hostel canteen, stating he acted out of frustration after being served allegedly substandard food.Gaikwad claimed he had complained about the quality of food at the canteen on four previous occasions. He said he had ordered dal, rice, and two chapatis to his room, but the food was inedible.“I had one bite and felt uneasy. After the second, I vomited. I was so angry that I left my room wearing just a vest and towel and went to the canteen,” Gaikwad told reporters. “I asked the staff to eat the same dal and rice, and they admitted it was not fit for consumption.”April 2025: Gaikwad accused police officers across Maharashtra of “harampan” – a colloquial term suggesting rogue behaviour – and claimed that if such practices were curbed, all illegal activities could be eliminated within a year.“The Maharashtra police is the most inefficient department of the government. My son received death threats, my car was attacked, but police failed to make any breakthrough,” he said.February 2024: He claimed to have hunted a tiger in 1987 and had been wearing its tooth around his neck since then. The forest department later seized the item and booked him under the Wildlife Protection Act. The tooth was sent for forensic examination.March 2024: A video surfaced showing Gaikwad beating a young man with a police baton during a Shiv Jayanti procession.September 2024: Gaikwad made headlines after announcing a reward of ?11 lakh to anyone who would chop off Congress MP Rahul Gandhi’s tongue, following Gandhi’s remarks on the reservation system.2021: While part of the undivided Shiv Sena and a member of the Uddhav Thackeray-led Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government, Gaikwad launched a personal attack on then Opposition Leader Devendra Fadnavis, saying he wanted to "take the corona[virus] and shove it down Fadnavis’ throat."
Article Summary: Sanjay Gaikwad is a two-time MLA from Buldhana, previously elected on a Shiv Sena ticket. In 2019, he defeated Harshawardhan Sapkal, who is currently the state Congress chief. He made headlines after announcing a reward of?11 lakh to anyone who would chop off Congress MP Rahul Gandhi's tongue.
